summary: This is an email from Chris Dilorio to an unspecified recipient, forwarding an appeal regarding a preliminary denial of an award application. The email alleges that the SEC has used the sender's information to bring and obstruct complaints, specifically referencing individuals and entities involved in securities fraud and money laundering schemes, including connections to Jeffrey Epstein's associate Joshie Sason.

persons.name: Chris Dilorio
persons.context: Sender of the email, appealing a preliminary denial of an award application and alleging the SEC used his information.

persons.name: Laney
persons.context: Recipient of the appeal, referenced as having issued a preliminary denial of an award application.

persons.name: McKessy
persons.context: Named as being in possession of the sender's 2013 TCR (Tip, Complaint or Referral) filed with Berger.

persons.name: Hoecker
persons.context: Named as being in possession of the sender's 2013 TCR (Tip, Complaint or Referral) filed with Berger.

persons.name: Berger
persons.context: Person with whom the sender filed a 2013 TCR (Tip, Complaint or Referral).

persons.name: Joshie Sason
persons.context: Referenced in connection with Hanover, Magna, and various companies (CGFIA, IMDS, NewLead, FreeSeas, PRTH). Allegedly involved in illegal activity detailed by the sender.

persons.name: Justin Keener
persons.context: Alleged illegal activity detailed in the sender's 2013 TCR. Customer in a FINRA World Trade Financial complaint, barred by FINRA as a 'Bad Actor' in 2013, and later involved with Blink Charging/New Image Concepts.

persons.name: Jaclin
persons.context: Referenced in an SEC 'Shell factory' complaint from 2016 related to New Image Concepts.

connections.description: Dilorio is appealing a preliminary denial made by Laney regarding an award application.
Dilorio provided information detailing the illegal activity of Joshie Sason to the SEC.
Dilorio detailed the illegal activity of Justin Keener in a 2013 TCR filed with the SEC.
Both are referred to as 'Bag Man' and are subjects of the sender's allegations regarding securities fraud and money laundering.

events.title: Dilorio files TCR with SEC
events.description: Chris Dilorio filed a Tip, Complaint or Referral (TCR) with SEC official Berger, detailing illegal activity of Joshie Sason and Justin Keener.

events.title: FINRA bars Justin Keener
events.description: FINRA barred Justin Keener/JMJ as a 'Bad Actor' following an investigation into anti-money laundering violations.

events.title: SEC files 'Shell factory' complaint
events.description: The SEC filed a complaint (Jaclin et al) against a 'shell factory' operation, which included the company New Image Concepts.

events.title: Dilorio appeals award denial
events.description: Chris Dilorio sends an email appeal regarding the preliminary denial of his Opco award application, alleging SEC misuse of his information.

keyFacts: The email alleges the SEC has used and obstructed complaints based on the sender's (Chris Dilorio) information.
Joshie Sason, an associate of Jeffrey Epstein, is implicated in securities fraud involving companies like Hanover, Magna, NewLead, and FreeSeas.
Justin Keener is described as a 'Bag Man' involved in money laundering through shell companies like Blink Charging (fka New Image Concepts) and was barred by FINRA in 2013.
The sender claims to have filed detailed TCRs (Tips, Complaints, or Referrals) with the SEC in 2013 regarding Sason and Keener's activities.
